sub_title: Gender, Security, and Financial Inclusion Expert focused on MENA, SEA and Sub Saharan Africa
summary:
With more than 10+ years of experience in international relations, economic development, and political empowerment spanning multiple world regions. I have honored my skills in grant writing, program management and implementation, auditing, assessment, donor, customer, and partner relations, and development and retention. As a Middle East and African expert fluent in Arabic and Farsi and working knowledge of French and Dutch, I have developed, managed, and led multi-country programs on the ground and in virtual space on global concurring projects.

I am highly organized and articulate, with an easy-going yet professional demeanor. I can help your organization, team, or business resolve and optimize its fundraising, operational, implementation capacity, sales, partner relation, and market share goals. 

My research and work interests revolve around the use of technology and data to provide solutions and insight into human rights, capacity development, and environmental preservation. I have worked on or led projects related to:

- Conducting ecosystem, risk, and country market analysis in conflict and vulnerable countries  such as Iraq, Syria,  Somalia, Lybia, Morocco, Mali, Burkina Faso, Chad, Niger, and Cote d’Ivoire, Benin, South Africa, Guatemala, and Bangladesh.

- Designed and managed the development and market penetration of Arabic and English e-educational research projects and platforms concurrently running across the MENA region.

- Leading Gender-Mainstreaming courses and a coined- Catalystas Gender benchmark and auditory system for private, NGO, educational and governmental institutions.I support organizations to understand their shortcoming in gender mainstreaming and supported them in building their capacity to become more equitable. 

-Secured more than 500 million Euros in client organization funding through philanthropic, institutional, and seed funding mechanisms.

-Managed and coordinated and implementation and reporting of women's rights, climate resilience, and economic empowerment program and portfolios in Afghanistan, Iran, Iraq, Iraqi-Kurdistan, Qatar, Yemen, Israel, Palestine, Lebanon, Jordan, Syria, Lebanon, Turkey, Egypt, Morocco, Kenya, Sierra Leone, Liberia, Niger, Chad, Burkina Faso, Mali, Cote d’Ivoire, South African, India, Bangladeshi and the United States. 

-Designing government and development organization gender, security, entrepreneurship and youth strategies. My previous work has supported the Kurdish Regional Government of Iraq,GIZ, The Dutch MFA

awards.title: Betty and David Jones Language Award
Maggie Award for Exceptional Young Women
awards.description:
Awarded to Beatrice Maneshi for her  exceptional work and advocacy for homeless and at-risk youth in the Butte country area, working both at 6th Street Homeless Youth Drop-In Center, Butte County Behavioral Services, and Homeless Emergency Runaway Effort (HERE) Program.

The Maggie Awards originated in 1994 as a way for the AS Women's Center and women's council to recognize Maggie Pattison, an office manager for the Associated Students. After her retirement in 1994, Pattison's legacy lives on through women in the community. The Maggie Awards are held to honor women's achievements and through their advocacy and ability to create change on a local, national and global level.

projects.title: Research Project and Advocacy Exhibition "Life, Death, and Art in in Syria"​
projects.description: Developed, fundraised and directed the launch of an advocacy campaign for our largest research project, “Life, Death, and Art in Syria”. In this project connected with Syrian refugee artists in Germany and Holland to develop an advocacy project engaging local Dutch audiences in compassionate understanding of war, migration, resettlement and Syrian identity through art. In collaboration with the artists I was able to presented this project under Fanack as a series of talks and exhibitions that was displayed at Nieuwspoort, as well as at the Social and Economic Council of the Netherlands’ 2017 Fiscal Planning hearing for the Refugee Integration project and at the Hague Institute for Peace and Global Justice during the “the Role of NATO in the Arab World” Conference. Our team along was able to utilized each showing of the exhibition as a platform for Syrians to open an earnest political and personal dialogue regarding their experiences both in Syria and in Holland. These sessions facilitated discussions with the general public and were also visited by key members of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Justices, Economic Affairs and foreign diplomatic staff.

projects.title: Android Occupy SF Communication App
projects.description:
Our application has been designed specifically for the occupy wall street movement chapter of San Francisco. this application is to help keep all members of the movement and also people interested and in support of the movement updated on important information and be able to share their thoughts an opinions. this application is initially installed on a ADROID device (preferably with an unlimited texting plan).  Once the application is downloaded people can send text messages to the phone number and the application will automatically ask them if thy would like to join the hub. Once they agree to join the Hub they are a part of the feed and can participate. The beauty of this application is that the hub can be used as a forum where any texts that comes into the HUB will be automatically send out to everyone, or the Hub administrator can choose to only have their messages send to the mass list of members. Or If the administrator wishes they can make it so that only they can send texts out to the group.
     This application is designed to bring together a community of people over mass texting which is not limited to only Smart phone users but anyone who has a cell phone and can receive text messages. This system of communication can bring together fast action in situations where people are not near a computer or the internet. Technology bringing people together to make changes in the world.

profile_positions.description:
❖	Developing tailor-fit: impact-based program and project design, event planning,  localized marketing and digital communication strategy, as well as monitoring and evaluation services for NGOs and business ventures working with or in the EMEA and North American region.

❖Financial and security risk analysis, due diligence reporting as well as business optimization modeling for NGOs and business across Europe the Middle East, Asia and Africa. 

❖Proposal and grant writing on behalf of both non-governmental and private sector clients.

❖Advising and teaching for: localization for EMEA region, large-scale event planning, financial risk, and security, as well as public relations.

❖ Business proposal drafting, expansion forecasting, and planning, brand and marketing strategy development.

❖ Research interrelated to the Middle East, Security, Policy analysis and  Risk Assessment
profile_positions.title: Founder, Lead Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Supporting the Dutch Enterprise Angency (RVO)and the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Zimbabwe create future international development strategy foused on promoting youth entrepreureship in the future. 
Leading a team of three researcher to undertake research on youth entrepreneurship actors, opportunties and challenges in the ICT, Waste mangement and Agriculture sectors in Harare, Bulawayo and Mutare.
Recommendations for future intervention planning will be formed based on mapping and assessment of youth entrepreneurship ecosystem which are aligned with the EKN Embassy in Zimbabwe's multi-annual country strategy (MACS) (2022-2026) that focuses on promoting youth employment and entrepreneurship, as well as the Netherlands’ Foreign Trade and Development Cooperation (BHOS) strategy.
profile_positions.title: External Consultant -Lead Researcher - Zimbabwe Youth Entrepreneurship Ecosystem Assessment

profile_positions.description:
Supporting the pre-baseline program implementation preparation, partnership planning, and baseline pre-planning design for the second iteration Network of Change (NOC) program, which focuses on reducing youth violent extremism in schools in Halbja, Raniyah, Kalar and potentially Mosul (based on feasibility). 

Leading the central researcher of the baseline study with a research team of four on behalf of the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs for two years, 2.5 million Euros.  

Support project team members with advisory support for methodologically sound programmatic monitoring and evaluation design.
profile_positions.title: Baseline and Program Launch Consultant - Networks of Change 2

profile_positions.description:
Leading the design and planning of the final external evaluation of the SPARK Jobs and Perspective (J&P) Program, which occurred between 2019-2023. The program, which is funded by the Dutch MFA, is worth upwards of 4 million Euros in funding and focused on supporting more than 3000 IDP And refugee youth in Ninawa and Erbil Iraq to become employed or gain access to higher education. 

Overseeing and utilizing the final evaluation using an outcome-harvesting methodology with a team of two researchers using interviews and surveys to determine the outcomes and impacts of the program. 

Drafting three concept notes for SPARK based on the outcomes of the program activities related to Bolonia process, private-sector to university interconnections and access to finance for SMEs in Iraq.
profile_positions.title: External Evaluator -  Jobs and Perspective Project Iraq

profile_positions.description: In 2022 and 2023 I will be support GIZ as an economic and gender expert in undertaking secondary research, designing primary research to cooperatively with the Kurdish Government's High Council for Women Development (HCWD) to design the 2030 Women Economic Empowerment Strategy. the project falls under GIZ's Private Sector Development & Employment Promotion (PSD) programming which includes various different focal point from GIZ in Iraq as well as local, private sector, NGO and governmental actors.
profile_positions.title: Economic Consultant - GIZ PSD Project Kurdish 2030 Strategy for Womens Economic Empowerment

profile_positions.title: Proposal Writing

profile_positions.description: Catalystas supported Search - Iraq in developing three concept notes aimed at a international donor. Our team was able support the creation of three tailored and targeted concept notes requesting upwards of 6 million USD in fundings.
profile_positions.title: Fundraising Consultant
UNHCR 1325 - Iraq National Action Plan IPS Baseline Lead Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Led a team of five researchers in a first of its kind scoping study on behalf of ActionAid UK into the status of womens rights in the single-instance labor market acquired through online platforms. The study focuses on Latin America (with a deeper dive into Colombia, Guatemala, and Brazil), Africa (with a deeper dive into Kenya, Ghana and South Africa) as well as South East Asia (with a focus on India, Bangladesh and Vietnam).
In this project I am leading research design, coordination, team management and quality control. In doing so our team will provide insights and stakeholder mappings which will help ActionAid plan its future strategies for intervention and support in this growing sector.
profile_positions.title: Lead Researcher - Womens Rights in Digital Gig-Economies Global Scoping Study

profile_positions.description: Designing a self-lead training for volunteer who will be undertaking door-to-door surveying in First Nation Communities with free roaming dog populations.  The self-lead training ensures that volunteers will interact with community respondent in an ethical and professional manner.
profile_positions.title: Ethical Surveying Trainer/ Designer

profile_positions.description: Leading a final evaluation of of a German funded program around protection and civilian harm mitigation taking place over the last five years in three locations across Iraq as well in capital (Baghdad) and Kurdistan Capital (Erbil). In this project I am leading a team of 17 researchers to undertake extensive data collection using a blended outcome-harvesting methodology. The final report will be used my CIVIC to evaluate its programming and seek to improve its future programming.
profile_positions.title: External Evaluator

profile_positions.description:
- Support Search for Common Ground Iraq, future program planning in line with the 2020-2025 Levant Strategy, but designing a select regional ecosystem and I(I)NGO ecosystem analysis. 

- Undertake contextually and stakeholders mapping in Basra, Salahadine, Ninawa, Kirkuk, and Diyala. 

- Undertake deep analysis interviews with key INGOs and undertake due diligence as a means to provide Search options for future potential partnerships. 

- Provide advice, guidance and inputs to future expansion and partnership strategy planning.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant - Iraqi Select Regional NGO Ecosystem Mapping

profile_positions.description:
- Design an in-depth, yet rapid baseline assessment, stakeholder mapping, and research study on behalf of JISRA (Joint Initiative for Strategic Religious Action) consisting of Search for Common Ground (lead in Iraq), Mensen Met Een Missie, Tear Funds, and  Peace and Freedom Organization (PFO) seeking to provide insights into the status and best practices for future interventions to promote freedom of religious belief and expression in Sinjar, Kirkuk and the Nianwa Plains. 

- Coordinated a research team of five directly (25 indirectly) to firstly complete Catalystas Intersectional Feminist Training on Ethical Data Collection in Conflict Zones and planning in order to undertake 100 KIIs, 26 FGS (8 persons each), and administer two served to collect over 450 responses in total. 

-oversaw and lead the implementation of data analysis, report writing, and client as well as key stakeholders exchange and lieason.
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Advisor - JISRA Iraq Basline and Research study on Freedom of Religious Belief

I am supporting Salwa by providing strategy design workshops, advice on fundraising and scaling and adaptation to COVID.

Web page development (back and front end), as well as IT response.  

English Editor for creative, academic, and journalistic English contributions and works.
